intro: Dracaena itumei, commonly known as the Red-veined Dracaena, is a species of flowering plant in the Asparagaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly found in regions of Malaysia and Indonesia. The plant is characterized by its striking, dark green leaves with prominent red veins, which give it its common name. It thrives in warm, humid environments and prefers well-draining soil. Dracaena itumei is often cultivated as a decorative indoor plant due to its aesthetic appeal and relatively low maintenance requirements.
